newsitem.title: USA: Broadway & Seymour Q4 oper shr breakeven.
newsitem.headline: Broadway & Seymour Q4 oper shr breakeven.

text.p: Broadway & Seymour Inc Thursday said that it broke even during the fourth quarter on an operational level, a major improvement over the previous four quarters that reflects its restructuring and the sale of non-core businesses.

The company reported for the three months ended December 31, 1996, net income of $1.1 million, or $0.13 per share, as compared with a net loss of $16.7 million, or $1.84 per share, for the three months ended December 31, 1995.

The company said the net income of $0.13 per share for the fourth quarter reflects a gain from the sale of the company's Corbel subsidiary to Sungard, completed in November 1996, and continuing income from the sale of the Company's Asset Management Group to Fidelity Investments, completed in May 1996. Further, the balance sheet at December 31, 1996 reflects a strong financial position with substantial working capital, liquidity and no bank debt, it added.
